attributes.action: Increase legal protections for temporary workers
attributes.additional_details: Employers are under no legal obligations to stick to start dates or maintain a worker for the duration of the initial assignment details. This means workers can be left unemployed with no notice, but temporary workers are still kept to a notice period if they want to leave. For people who have a job opportunity in the future, temp work is often the only option for them. There needs to be better protection for all workers, permanent or temporary.
attributes.background: Currently there is no legal protection for temporary workers. A worker can be given an assignment and the employer can cancel it or change the start date at any point. You can turn up on a day and be told them and there that the assignment is over. This leads to unstable financial situations.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. You could start a petition which clearly outlines what protections you would like the UK Government and Parliament to introduce.
